activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
Robert D Groh was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Robert D Groh was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert D Groh

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 006108,
Payable Number: 67278,
Receipt Number: 22R 004569,
Amount: $20.00

1:46 PM Defendant Robert D Groh in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Robert D Groh.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Court speaks about the prior case where RG waived this right to challenge the extradition. Court speaks about the couple letters that have been filed after the last hearing. RG states that he doesn't want Attorney Erickson to representing him. Court states that she is willing to withdraw the waiver. RG would like to proceed today and informs the court that he has an attorney. RG speaks about Attorney Burdick being his attorney and was told to inform him what happens today. Attorney Burdick wasn't able to be here today.

Court withdraws the waiver.

Court speaks about his right to an attorney. Court verbally goes over the wavier of rights to an attorney. Court will allow RG to proceed today without an attorney.

Court speaks about this case and informs the defendant that bail isn't an option after a governor warrant. Court speaks about a writ that needs to be filed. 

RG speaks about open case in the State of Wisconsin. Court advises RG to speak to an attorney about this. 

RG asks for a hearing on Monday.

Court sets a deadline of for the writ of 10/28/22. 

State speaks that a complaint isn't needed per statue.

Court set the next hearing for 11/10/22 at 8:30 AM
Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Harper appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Erickson appear in person for the Defense. Robert Groh appears in person, in custody.

Court speaks that we are here today for an extradition warrant and reads part of the warrant. Court speaks about the demand that has been made of RG surrender, reads the charges and speaks about RG rights. 

RG speaks about being picked up multiple times about this. Court explains the extradition warrant and gives RG his options.

RG speaks with his attorney. 

RG waives his right.

Court finds that RG doesn't contest the legality of his arrest. 

Court orders that RG be returned to that State of Illinois.
